channel.title: INsmh
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INsmh, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'I'm a ghost-hunting bus driver - here are some of the things to have terrified me'
item.description: Ken Oliver, 40, has been fascinated by the paranormal since he was a child and his house backed on to a cemetery and has so far visited 50 haunted pla...

item.title: Police across US given new UFO handbook as they ‘pose significant safety risks’
item.description: The document was created to protect officers from the 'unknown threat they may pose.'

item.title: Menopause brings new power and freedom for women, research finds
item.description: A study of 1,000 females who have been through or are currently experiencing the hormonal change found 24% are more comfortable in themselves since go...

item.title: Croissant-shaped lamp bought on Temu turns out to be an actual croissant
item.description: 'The ants were going in the hole,' she explained. 'So I just poked a bigger hole.'

item.title: King Charles' fishing secrets revealed - by master craftsman behind his catches
item.description: Master craftsman Harry Jamieson, 79, is hanging up his tools after making 4,000 rods for the likes of King Charles, Queen Camilla and celebrities incl...

item.title: World’s oldest whale found with 100-year-old harpoon in its side
item.description: ‘He couldn't have been that bothered if he lived for another 100 years.’

item.title: How to get £75 wrinkle-reducing Elizabeth Arden retinol cream for £48 plus 7 free products

item.title: Cat makes history by becoming first feline to complete Three Peaks Challenge
item.description: Louis has become the first feline in history to conquer the legendary hiking challenge.

item.title: Government says it will not 'water down' decision to stop winter fuel payments
item.description: Chancellor Reeves justified the need for means-testing the benefit, which can total up to £300, saying that it's crucial for plugging the 'black hole'...
